question: Which country houses the "Sataplia Managed Reserve"?
explanation: Sataplia Managed Reserve is an IUCN category IV habitat/species management area and a protected area and tourist attraction of Georgia. The visitors centre is located in village lower Alvani at the slopes of an extinct volcano â€” Mount Sataplia. The name Sataplia can be freely translated as a "honey place" and in fact bees used to live in small holes and caves and honey was harvested by the local population. Sataplia Managed Reserve is part of Imereti Caves Protected Areas, which also includes Sataplia Strict Nature Reserve, Prometheus Cave Natural Monument.
